name: Raising the Roof: on-screen levity on rooftop
description: Performances soar to new heights on the rooftop, not only showcasing skylines but also creating electrifying drama, comedy and spectacle.

key_work.title: Leaps and Bounds – Paul Kelly and the Coloured Girls
key_work.brief_description: A love letter to Melbourne – where Paul Kelly lived during the late 70s – the music video for Leaps and Bounds (1987) shows sweeping views across the city’s skyline and much-loved landmarks like the MCG.

constellations_primary.name: Raising the Roof: on-screen levity on rooftop
constellations_primary.description: Performances soar to new heights on the rooftop, not only showcasing skylines but also creating electrifying drama, comedy and spectacle.

start.title: Leaps and Bounds – Paul Kelly and the Coloured Girls
start.brief_description: A love letter to Melbourne – where Paul Kelly lived during the late 70s – the music video for Leaps and Bounds (1987) shows sweeping views across the city’s skyline and much-loved landmarks like the MCG.

end.title: Let It Be
end.creator_credit: Michael Lindsay-Hogg, Allen Klein, Mal Evans, Neil Aspinall, ABKCO Films and Apple Corps
end.brief_description: Documentary film about The Beatles rehearsing and recording songs for the album Let It Be in January 1969. The film features an unannounced rooftop concert by the group, their last performance in public. Released just after the album, it was the final original Beatles release. This film has not been commercially available since the 1980s.

constellations_other.name: Raising the Roof: on-screen levity on rooftop
constellations_other.description: Performances soar to new heights on the rooftop, not only showcasing skylines but also creating electrifying drama, comedy and spectacle.

links.description: ‘Leaps and Bounds’ features a rooftop performance with stunning vista of Melbourne. Michael Lindsay-Hogg’s fly on the wall documentary not only captures The Beatles’ famous rooftop concert but also depicts what some call be the beginning of end for the group.

start.title: Let It Be
start.creator_credit: Michael Lindsay-Hogg, Allen Klein, Mal Evans, Neil Aspinall, ABKCO Films and Apple Corps
start.brief_description: Documentary film about The Beatles rehearsing and recording songs for the album Let It Be in January 1969. The film features an unannounced rooftop concert by the group, their last performance in public. Released just after the album, it was the final original Beatles release. This film has not been commercially available since the 1980s.

end.title: Moulin Rouge!
end.creator_credit: Baz Luhrmann, Catherine Knapman, Catherine Martin, Fred Baron, Martin Brown, Philip Martin Brown and Steve E. Andrews
end.headline_credit: Australia and United States of America, 2001
end.brief_description: A celebration of love and creative inspiration takes place in the infamous, gaudy and glamorous Parisian nightclub, at the cusp of the 20th century. A young poet, who is plunged into the heady world of Moulin Rouge, begins a passionate affair with the club’s most notorious and beautiful star.

constellations_other.name: Raising the Roof: on-screen levity on rooftop
constellations_other.description: Performances soar to new heights on the rooftop, not only showcasing skylines but also creating electrifying drama, comedy and spectacle.

constellations_other.name: Diamonds are still a girl's best friend
constellations_other.description: This constellation explores the continuing cultural impact of Marylin Monroe’s iconic performance of 'Diamonds are a Girl’s Best Friend' in Gentlemen prefer Blondes (1953).

constellations_other.name: Jill Bilcock
constellations_other.description: An editor’s work often goes unnoticed, but their scene-stitching not only brings the director’s vision to life but sometimes steals the show. One of Australia’s greatest editors, Jill Bilcock, has shaped some of the country’s most memorable screen stories.

constellations_other.name: Oscar-winning transformations and prosthetics
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores how craft help actors undergo award-winning transformations into iconic characters.

links.description: The stunning production design and jukebox musical stylings of Baz Luhrmann’s Moulin Rouge! give audiences dazzling spectacle in every scene. The skyline of Paris providing the ultimate backdrop for the lover’s romantic first meeting.

start.title: Moulin Rouge!

end.title: The Aristocats
end.creator_credit: Wolfgang Reitherman, Winston Hibler, Walt Disney Pictures, Walt Disney Productions, Eric Cleworth, Frank Thomas, Julius Svendsen, Ken Anderson, Larry Clemmons, Ralph Wright and Vance Gerry
end.brief_description: When Madame Adelaide Bonfamille leaves her fortune to Duchess and her children—Bonfamille’s beloved family of cats—the butler plots to steal the money and kidnaps the legatees, leaving them out on a country road. All seems lost until the wily Thomas O’Malley Cat and his jazz-playing alley cats come to the aristocats’ rescue.

constellations_other.name: Raising the Roof: on-screen levity on rooftop
constellations_other.description: Performances soar to new heights on the rooftop, not only showcasing skylines but also creating electrifying drama, comedy and spectacle.

links.description: The Paris horizon also features in the charmingly animated The Aristocats. Proving that the romantic musical is not just for humans the film expertly weaves together comedy and jazz music with an energetic plot.

start.title: The Aristocats
start.creator_credit: Wolfgang Reitherman, Winston Hibler, Walt Disney Pictures, Walt Disney Productions, Eric Cleworth, Frank Thomas, Julius Svendsen, Ken Anderson, Larry Clemmons, Ralph Wright and Vance Gerry
start.brief_description: When Madame Adelaide Bonfamille leaves her fortune to Duchess and her children—Bonfamille’s beloved family of cats—the butler plots to steal the money and kidnaps the legatees, leaving them out on a country road. All seems lost until the wily Thomas O’Malley Cat and his jazz-playing alley cats come to the aristocats’ rescue.

end.title: The Secret Life of Us
end.brief_description: The Secret Life of Us is an Australian television drama series about the lives of 20-30 somethings living in the early 2000s.

constellations_other.name: 2000s TV
constellations_other.description: The dawn of the new millennium brought a wave of Australian programming that was more ambitious and bolder than previous decades.

constellations_other.name: The secret life of suburbia and music videos
constellations_other.description: Australia's famous streets and suburbs have defined music videos, TV shows and miniseries, providing a unique backdrop to Australian stories and music.

constellations_other.name: Raising the Roof: on-screen levity on rooftop
constellations_other.description: Performances soar to new heights on the rooftop, not only showcasing skylines but also creating electrifying drama, comedy and spectacle.

links.description: Melbourne’s beachside suburb of St Kilda is gloriously depicted as the backyard for a group of friends sharing the same apartment block in The Secret Life of Us. Their friendships, careers and intertwined romances often playing out on the apartment’s rooftop.

start.title: The Secret Life of Us

end.title: Infernal Affairs
end.creator_credit: Alan Mak, Andrew Lau, Media Asia Films and Felix Chong
end.brief_description: Chan Wing Yan, a young police officer, has been sent undercover as a mole in the local mafia. Lau Kin Ming, a young mafia member, infiltrates the police force. Years later, their older counterparts, Chen Wing Yan and Inspector Lau Kin Ming, respectively, race against time to expose the mole within their midst.

constellations_other.name: Raising the Roof: on-screen levity on rooftop
constellations_other.description: Performances soar to new heights on the rooftop, not only showcasing skylines but also creating electrifying drama, comedy and spectacle.

constellations_other.name: Wong Kar-Wai's Hollywood fingerprints
constellations_other.description: Wong Kar-wai’s modern masterpiece In The Mood For Love is a rich, romantic melodrama that follows the entangled lives of two neighbours (Tony Leung and Maggie Cheung) who develop feelings for each other after learning their spouses are having an affair.

links.description: Set high against the vast Hong Kong cityscape, the climax of Infernal Affairs is utterly gripping. With the truth about to be revealed, Chan and Lau find themselves fighting for their real identities both determined to come out on top.
